adjectives.description: dispirited (comparative more dispirited, superlative most dispirited)

entries.meaning: Without energy, gusto or drive, enervated, without the will to accomplish, disheartened.
examples: So dispirited were the troops after the loss of their beloved commander that they moped about and could barely be bothered to eat let alone load their guns.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of dispirit
